revised_title: The Conveyance of Liquors in Lacteals
tldr: The author, William Musgrave, conducted experiments to study the lacteals and their role in conveying liquors in the digestive system. He discovered that the lacteals often carry liquors that are not white, and that they contain a transparent, pellucid liquid called "Liquor Refluus." This finding challenges the existing understanding of the lacteals and their function in the body.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Animal Physiology
